algorithms.correlation

Class BruteForce

extends java.lang.Object
    implemented from useful for Mahalanobis distance among many things.
    Author:
    nichole

      static double[][] covariance2(double[][] a)
      calculate the covariance matrix for a using simplest brute force method Cov_a = (1/n) a * a^T for a being standardized to subtract the mean of each type from the measurement of same type.

    • Method Detail

      • correlation

        public static double[][] correlation(double[][] a)
        calculate the correlation matrix for a using a brute force method
        Parameters:
        a - an mxn matrix of data with the dimensions being columns and the datum number being rows. 
         e.g.  a[0] = new double[]{10, 100, 1000}
       a[1] = new double[]{ 9, 110, 900}
        Returns:
        the correlation matrix as a double array of size [a[0].length][a[0].length]

      • covariance

        public static double[][] covariance(double[][] a)
        calculate the covariance matrix for a using a brute force method. The covariance matrix is also known as auto-covariance matrix, dispersion matrix, variance matrix, and the variance–covariance matrix.
        Parameters:
        a - an mxn matrix of data with the dimensions being columns and the datum number being rows. 
         e.g.  a[0] = new double[]{10, 100, 1000}
       a[1] = new double[]{ 9, 110, 900}
        Returns:
        the covariance matrix as a double array of size [a[0].length][a[0].length]

      • covariance2

        public static double[][] covariance2(double[][] a)
        calculate the covariance matrix for a using simplest brute force method Cov_a = (1/n) a * a^T for a being standardized to subtract the mean of each type from the measurement of same type. The covariance matrix is also known as auto-covariance matrix, dispersion matrix, variance matrix, and the variance–covariance matrix.
        Parameters:
        a - an mxn matrix of data with the dimensions being rows and the datum number being columns. NOTE that a must be "zero mean" centered. 
         e.g.  a[0] = new double[]{10,  9}
       a[1] = new double[]{99,  100}
       a[2] = new double[]{1000, 900}
        Returns:
        the covariance matrix as a double array of size [a[0].length][a[0].length]
